title: About
text:
At the time that this website is created, we are two students of the Research Master of Economics in Sciences Po, and this website aims to host our presentation for the Macroeconomics 3 Class.
Feel free to reach out to us via our academic mail “first_name.family_name@sciencespo.fr” :

GUGELMO CAVALHEIRO DIAS Paulo
SHARMA Vivan

title: Complement
text: This is a complementary description of the empirical facts we focus on during our presentation of this article.

title: Macroeconomic 3 Presentation
text:
Hello, we are SHARMA Vivan and GUGELMO CAVALHEIRO DIAS Paulo, and this is the website of our Macroeconomic 3 presentation, dedicated to the review of the empirical facts and macroeconomic theory behind the paper of Junia Howell, and James R. Elliott, Damages Done: The Longitudinal Impacts of Natural Hazards on Wealth Inequality in the United States, available online at this link or here.
Here are some useful resources :

The slides of our presentation (Here the LaTeX code)
An description of the main empirical facts of the paper
A detailed summary of the whole paper
A video presentation about “How Natural Disasters Feed Social Inequality” by James R. Elliott
